alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 8:07PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo. In north central New Mexico, Sandoval. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 806 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving east into the Albuquerque Metro Area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Bernalillo, Corrales, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Paradise Hills, Cabezon, Rio Rancho Intel Area, North Valley, Vista Hills, South Valley, Northern Meadows, Rio Rancho City Center, Sandia Pueblo, Mariposa, Enchanted Hills, Isleta Pueblo, Sandia Heights, Coronado State Monument and Santa Ana Pueblo. - This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 9. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 208 and 244. Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 140 and 170. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remember, ditches are deadly. A gentle flow of water can become a raging torrent in a few minutes.
